GENERAL.DESC: User configuration is stored in browser cache. Server-side storage will be supported in a future release.

EXPERIMENTAL.DESC: You may try the experimental features.

INSTALLATION.APPLICATION_NAME_DUPLICATION_CHECK: You can check if application name is duplicated.
INSTALLATION.AGENT_ID_DUPLICATION_CHECK: You can check if agent id is duplicated.

USER_GROUP.VALIDATION: Enter only numbers, alphabets, and '-', '_' characters.(4~30)

VALIDATION.USER_ID: Enter only numbers, alphabets lowercase, and '-' ,'_' characters.(4~24)
VALIDATION.USER_NAME: Enter only numbers, alphabets, Hangeul, and '-', '_', '.' characters.(1~30)
VALIDATION.USER_DEPARTMENT: Enter only numbers, alphabets, Hangeul, and '-', '_', '.' characters.(3~40)

ALARM.NAME: Alarm
ALARM.DESC:
Application's status is periodically checked and alarm is triggered if certain pre-configured conditions (rules) are satisfied.
pinpoint-batch server checks every 3 minutes based on the last 5 minutes of data.
And if the conditions are satisfied, it sends sms/email/webhook to the users listed in the user group.

SERVER_MAP.TITLE: Server Map
SERVER_MAP.DESC: Displays a topological view of the distributed server map.

ITEMS.DESC: Each node is a logical unit of application.
The integer value inside of the node represents the number of server instances assigned to that application. (Not shown when there is only one such instance.)
An alarm icon will be displayed inside of the node if an error/exception is detected in one of the server instances.
When the node is selected, the transaction information flowing into the application is displayed on the right side of the screen.
Each arrow represents a transaction flow.
The number shows the transaction count. Displayed in red for error counts that exceeds the threshold.
When the arrow is selected, the transaction information that passes through the selected section is displayed on the right side of the screen.
Right-clicking on an arrow displays the context menu for filtering.
The Filter in the Context menu shows only the transactions that pass through the selected section.
Filter wizard allows you to configure more detailed filters.
Right-clicking on any blank area displays a server map configuration menu.
Merge: Groups all mergeable nodes and displays it as a single node.
Refresh: Initialize the viewport and the zoom level of the server map.

CPU_USAGE.TITLE: Cpu Usage

ITEMS.NAME: Skipped Continuation (S.S.C)

ITEMS.DESC: All transactions

ACTIVE_REQUEST.TITLE: Active Request
ACTIVE_REQUEST.DESC: Snapshots of the agent's active request status, categorized by how long they have been active for serving a request.

ITEMS.NAME: Fast (1s)
ITEMS.DESC: Number of requests that have been active for less than or equal to 1s

ITEMS.NAME: Normal (3s)
ITEMS.DESC: Number of requests that have been active for less than or equal to 3s but longer than 1s

ITEMS.NAME: Slow (5s)
ITEMS.DESC: Number of requests that have been active for less than or equal to 5s but longer than 3s

ITEMS.NAME: Very Slow (slow)
ITEMS.DESC: Number of requests that have been active for longer than 5s

ALARM.TITLE: Types of Alarm Rule
ALARM.DESC: The following types of alarm rules are supported by Pinpoint.

ITEMS.NAME: SLOW COUNT
ITEMS.DESC: Triggered when the number of slow requests sent to the application exceeds the configured threshold.

ITEMS.NAME: SLOW RATE
ITEMS.DESC: Triggered when the percentage(%) of slow requests sent to the application exceeds the configured threshold.

ITEMS.NAME: ERROR COUNT
ITEMS.DESC: Triggered when the number of failed requests sent to the application exceeds the configured threshold.

ITEMS.NAME: ERROR RATE
ITEMS.DESC: Triggered when the percentage(%) of failed requests sent to the application exceeds the configured threshold.

ITEMS.NAME: TOTAL COUNT
ITEMS.DESC: Triggered when the number of all requests sent to the application exceeds the configured threshold.

ITEMS.NAME: SLOW COUNT TO CALLEE
ITEMS.DESC: Triggered when the number of slow requests sent by the application exceeds the configured threshold. You must specify the domain or the address(ip, port) in the 'Notes' field: ex) www.naver.com, 127.0.0.1:8080

ITEMS.NAME: SLOW RATE TO CALLEE
ITEMS.DESC: Triggered when the percentage(%) of slow requests sent by the application exceeds the configured threshold. You must specify the domain or the address(ip, port) in the 'Notes' field: ex) www.naver.com, 127.0.0.1:8080

ITEMS.NAME: ERROR COUNT TO CALLEE
ITEMS.DESC: Triggered when the number of failed requests sent by the application exceeds the configured threshold. You must specify the domain or the address(ip, port) in the 'Notes' field: ex) www.naver.com, 127.0.0.1:8080

ITEMS.NAME: ERROR RATE TO CALLEE
ITEMS.DESC: Triggered when the percentage(%) of failed requests sent by the application exceeds the configured threshold. You must specify the domain or the address(ip, port) in the 'Notes' field: ex) www.naver.com, 127.0.0.1:8080

ITEMS.NAME: TOTAL COUNT TO CALLEE
ITEMS.DESC: Triggered when the number of all requests sent by the application exceeds the configured threshold. You must specify the domain or the address(ip, port) in the 'Notes' field: ex) www.naver.com, 127.0.0.1:8080

ITEMS.NAME: HEAP USAGE RATE
ITEMS.DESC: Triggered when the application's heap usage(%) exceeds the configured threshold.

ITEMS.NAME: JVM CPU USAGE RATE
ITEMS.DESC: Triggered when the application's CPU usage(%) exceeds the configured threshold.

ITEMS.NAME: SYSTEM CPU USAGE RATE
ITEMS.DESC: Sends an alarm when the application's CPU usage(%) exceeds the configured threshold.

ITEMS.NAME: DATASOURCE CONNECTION USAGE RATE
ITEMS.DESC: Triggered when the application's DataSource connection usage(%) exceeds the configured threshold.

ITEMS.NAME: DEADLOCK OCCURRENCE
ITEMS.DESC: Sends an alarm when deadlock condition is detected in application.

ITEMS.NAME: FILE DESCRIPTOR COUNT
ITEMS.DESC: Sends an alarm when the number of open file descriptors exceeds the configured threshold.
<FaSmileBeam size="15" color="#41c464"/> Execellent
<FaSmile size="15" color="#469ae4"/> Good
<FaMeh size="15"/>  Fair
<FaFrown size="15" color="#ff8c00"/> Poor

ITEMS.NAME: <Lt/> 0.5
ITEMS.DESC: <FaAngry size="15" color="#eb4747"/> Unacceptable
Field, tag have the relationships 1(field):N(tag), 1(tag):N(field).
If you first select the attribute that results in '1' in 1:N, the 'N' attribute is determined automatically.
